pixi.primitives.Graphics

type
class
extends
pixi.display.DisplayObjectContainer
metadata
:native
"PIXI.Graphics"

Static Variables

CIRC : Int

ELIP : Int

POLY : Int

RECT : Int

RREC : Int

Constructor

new()
The Graphics class contains a set of methods that you can use to create primitive shapes and lines. It is important to know that with the webGL renderer only simple polygons can be filled at this stage Complex polygons will not be filled. Heres an example of a complex polygon: http://www.goodboydigital.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/06/complexPolygon.png

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObject
NYI Holds whether or not this object is dynamic, for rendering optimization

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObject
The opacity of the object.

The blend mode to be applied to the graphic shape

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObject
The original, cached bounds of the object

boundsPadding : Float

the bounds' padding used for bounds calculation

buttonMode : Bool

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObject
This is used to indicate if the displayObject should display a mouse hand cursor on rollover

cacheAsBitmap : Bool

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObject
Set weather or not a the display objects is cached as a bitmap. This basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects To remove filters simply set this property to 'null'

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObjectContainer
read-only The array of children of this container.

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObject

Current path

defaultCursor : String

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObject
This is the cursor that will be used when the mouse is over this object. To enable this the element must have interaction = true and buttonMode = true

dirty : Dynamic

Used to detect if the graphics object has changed if this is set to true then the graphics object will be recalculated

fillAlpha : Float

The alpha of the fill of this graphics object

filterArea : pixi.core.Rectangle

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObject
The area the filter is applied to like the hitArea this is used as more of an optimisation rather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle

filters : Array<Dynamic>

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObject
Sets the filters for the displayObject. * IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer. To remove filters simply set this property to 'null'

graphicsData : Array<Dynamic>

Graphics data

height : Float

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObjectContainer
The height of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

hitArea : Dynamic

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObject
This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default. Setting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

interactive : Bool

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObject
Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default

isMask : Dynamic

Whether this shape is being used as a mask

lineColor : String

The color of any lines drawn

lineWidth : Float

The width of any lines drawn

mask : pixi.primitives.Graphics

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObject
Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it. In PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping. To remove a mask, set this property to null.

addChild(child : DisplayObject) : Void

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObjectContainer
parameters
child {DisplayObject} The DisplayObject to add to the container
Adds a child to the container.

addChildAt(child : DisplayObject, index : Int) : Void

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObjectContainer
parameters
child {DisplayObject} The child to add
index {Number} The index to place the child in
Adds a child to the container at a specified index. If the index is out of bounds an error will be thrown

arc(cx : Float, cy : Float, radius : Float, startAngle : Float, endAngle : Float, ?anticlockwise : Bool) : Graphics

parameters
cx {Number} The x-coordinate of the center of the circle
cy {Number} The y-coordinate of the center of the circle
radius {Number} The radius of the circle
startAngle {Number} The starting angle, in radians (0 is at the 3 o'clock position of the arc's circle)
endAngle {Number} The ending angle, in radians
anticlockwise {Bool} Optional. Specifies whether the drawing should be counterclockwise or clockwise. False is default, and indicates clockwise, while true indicates counter-clockwise.
returns
{Graphics}
The arc method creates an arc/curve (used to create circles, or parts of circles).

arcTo(x1 : Float, y1 : Float, x2 : Float, y2 : Float, radius : Float) : Graphics

beginFill(color : Int, ?alpha : Float) : Graphics

parameters
color {Number} the color of the fill
alpha {Number} the alpha of the fill
returns
{Graphics}
Specifies a simple one-color fill that subsequent calls to other Graphics methods (such as lineTo() or drawCircle()) use when drawing.

bezierCurveTo(cpX : Float, cpY : Float, cpX2 : Float, cpY2 : Float, toX : Float, toY : Float) : Graphics

parameters
{number} cpX Control point x
{number} cpY Control point y
{number} cpX2 Second Control point x
{number} cpY2 Second Control point y
{number} toX Destination point x
{number} toY Destination point y
returns
{PIXI.Graphics}
Calculate the points for a bezier curve.

clear() : Graphics

returns
{Graphics}
Clears the graphics that were drawn to this Graphics object, and resets fill and line style settings.

destroyCachedSprite() : Void

Destroys a previous cached sprite.

parameters
x {Number} The X coordinate of the center of the circle
y {Number} The Y coordinate of the center of the circle
radius {Number} The radius of the circle
returns
{Graphics}
Draws a circle.

parameters
x {Number} The X coordinate of the center of the ellipse
y {Number} The Y coordinate of the center of the ellipse
width {Number} The half width of the ellipse
height {Number} The half height of the ellipse
returns
{Graphics}
Draws an ellipse.

parameters

returns
{Graphics}
Draws a polygon using the given path.

{Graphics}

width {Number} The width of the rectangle
height {Number} The height of the rectangle
radius {Number} Radius of the rectangle corners
returns
{Graphics}

drawShape(shape : pixi.core.Circle) : GraphicsData

parameters
{Circle|Rectangle|Ellipse|Line|Polygon} shape The Shape object to draw.
returns
{GraphicsData} The generated GraphicsData object.
Draws the given shape to this Graphics object. Can be any of Circle, Rectangle, Ellipse, Line or Polygon.

returns
{Graphics}
Applies a fill to the lines and shapes that were added since the last call to the beginFill() method.

lineStyle(lineWidth : Float, ?color : Int, ?alpha : Float) : Graphics

parameters
lineWidth {Number} width of the line to draw, will update the object's stored style
color {Number} color of the line to draw, will update the object's stored style
alpha {Number} alpha of the line to draw, will update the object's stored style
Specifies the line style used for subsequent calls to Graphics methods such as the lineTo() method or the drawCircle() method.

lineTo(x : Float, y : Float) : Graphics

parameters
x {Number} the X coordinate to draw to
y {Number} the Y coordinate to draw to
Draws a line using the current line style from the current drawing position to (x, y); the current drawing position is then set to (x, y).

moveTo(x : Float, y : Float) : Graphics

parameters
x {Number} the X coordinate to move to
y {Number} the Y coordinate to move to
Moves the current drawing position to (x, y).

quadraticCurveTo(cx : Float, cy : Float, radius : Float, startAngle : Float, endAngle : Float, ?anticlockwise : Float) : Graphics

parameters
{number} cx The x-coordinate of the center of the circle
{number} cy The y-coordinate of the center of the circle
{number} radius The radius of the circle
{number} startAngle The starting angle, in radians (0 is at the 3 o'clock position of the arc's circle)
{number} endAngle The ending angle, in radians
{number} anticlockwise Optional. Specifies whether the drawing should be counterclockwise or clockwise. False is default, and indicates clockwise, while true indicates counter-clockwise.
returns
{PIXI.Graphics}
The arc() method creates an arc/curve (used to create circles, or parts of circles).

setInteractive(interactive : Bool) : Void

inherited from pixi.display.DisplayObject
deprecated
Simply set the `interactive` property directly
parameters
interactive {Bool}
Deprecated Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default Instead of using this function you can now simply set the interactive property to true or false
